wikipedia_page.main: Captain Solomon Clifford Joseph  (29 April 1893 – 21 March 1966) was a British flying ace of the Royal Naval Air Service during World War I. He was credited with thirteen confirmed aerial victories.Postwar, Joseph moved into engineering and manufacturing. He acquired components of New Imperial Motors upon its dissolution in 1939, and produced aircraft parts for the British war effort of World War II. After World War II, he turned his company's manufacturing to agricultural machinery.
